page.title: 07The Lightkeepers
page.content: The only people living on Inchkeith today are the lightkeepers. There are at present three lightkeepers on Inchkeith, a Principal and two Assistants. The families of the lightkeepers no longer live on the island but are housed in Edinburgh. They can, however visit quite often, coming out on the supply boat or pilot boat. The men are keep busy practically 24hours a day. During the day cleaning and maintenance is done and a watch is kept for fog. At night there are shifts for keeping a watch on the light, this is made easier by a mirror which has been strategically placed in the drying green at the rear of the living quarters, which are now in a separate building from the lighthouse. This enables the keeper on watch to keep an eye on the light simply by glancing out of the window.
